        y = params[1::3]
        r = params[2::3]

    # For n=26, r=0.1014 is a common average.

        radii[i] = r_i

    for i in range(n):
        for j in range(i + 1, n):
            dist = np.linalg.norm(centers[i] - centers[j])
            if radii[i] + radii[j] > dist:
                ratio = dist / (radii[i] + radii[j])
                radii[i] *= (ratio * 0.99)

    sum_radii = np.sum(radii)
    return centers, radii, sum_radii
